intro: Campylanthus glaber, commonly known as the smooth campylanthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue to purple flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. Campylanthus glaber is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
